metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32292 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In ConnMan through 1.41, remote attackers able to send HTTP requests to thegweb component are able to exploit a heap-based buffer overflow inreceived_data to execute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
connman-vpn - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.36-2ubuntu0.1').
